model = Sequential()

# first Convolutional layer
# filters: number of convolution kernel
# kernel_size:convolution windows
# strides
# padding: same/valid
# activation

model.add(Convolution2D(input_shape=(28,28,1),filters=32,kernel_size=5,strides=1,padding='same',activation='relu'))

# first pooling layer(input_shape→(14,14,1))
model.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=2,strides=2,padding='same'))

# second convolution layer
model.add(Convolution2D(filters=64,kernel_size=5,strides=1,padding='same',activation='relu'))

# second pooling layer(input_shape→(7,7,1))
model.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=2,strides=2,padding='same'))

# tranform the second pooling layer to one dimention(flatten_shape=(64,7,7))
model.add(Flatten())

# add the first fully connected layer
model.add(Dense(1024,activation='relu'))

# Dropout
model.add(Dropout(0.5))

# the second fully connected layer
model.add(Dense(10,activation='softmax'))

# define optimizer
adam = Adam(lr=1e-4)

# compile the model
model.compile(optimizer=adam,loss='categorical_crossentropy',metrics=['accuracy'])

# fit model
model.fit(x_train, y_train, batch_size=64, epochs=10)

# evaluate the model
loss, accuracy = model.evaluate(x_test, y_test)
print('test loss:', loss)
print('test accuracy:', accuracy)
